lines.content: Jarvis is a Java app for managing your daily tasks, optimized for use via a Command Line Interface (CLI). Given below are instructions on how to use it.
❗ `Prerequisites:` Ensure you have Java 11 installed in your Computer.
On launch, you should see this interface:
Hello Sir! I am JARVIS, your personal assistant!
Users may **add**, **view**, **delete** and **search** for tasks as needed.
Jarvis supports 3 types of tasks: `ToDo`, `Deadline` and `Event`.
`Deadline:` Task to be completed by a deadline.
`Event:` Task to start at a start time and end at an end time.
Adds a new `ToDo` task to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have [NUMBER OF TASKS] tasks in the list sir.
Invalid format. Description cannot be empty for todo sir.
Adds a new `Deadline` task to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have [NUMBER OF TASKS] tasks in the list sir.
Adds a new `Event` task to the task list.
**Format**: event [TASK NAME] /from [START TIME in dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm] /to [END TIME in dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm]
Got it. I've added this task:
[E][] [TASK NAME] (from: [DAY, MMM dd, yyyy HH AM/PM] to: [DAY, MMM dd, yyyy HH AM/PM])
Now you have [NUMBER OF TASKS] tasks in the list sir.
Lists all tasks in the task list.
2: [E][] [TASK NAME] (from: [DAY, MMM dd, yyyy HH AM/PM] to: [DAY, MMM dd, yyyy HH AM/PM])
Task list is empty! Please add a task sir.
❗**TASK INDEX must be within the size of the task list**
Nice! I've marked this task as done sir:
❗**TASK INDEX must be within the size of the task list**
Oh NO! I've unmarked this task as undone sir:
Delete a task from the task list.
❗**TASK INDEX must be within the size of the task list**
Noted sir. I've removed this task sir:
Now you have [NUMBER OF TASKS] tasks in the list!
Search for a task from the task list via description
💡**Search will return all tasks which description contains the search keyword**
- find /description homework will return tasks with descriptions "homework", "linear algebra homework", "science homework"
Here are tasks that matched your search sir:
❗**If no matches are found, this will be the error prompt:**
No results found. Please check your keyword is correct sir?
Good bye sir! Have a good day
Jarvis is a Java app for managing your daily tasks, optimized for use via a Command Line Interface (CLI). Given below are instructions on how to use it.
❗ `Prerequisites:` Ensure you have Java 11 installed in your Computer.
On launch, you should see this interface:
Hello Sir! I am JARVIS, your personal assistant!
Users may **add**, **view**, **delete** and **search** for tasks as needed.
Jarvis supports 3 types of tasks: `ToDo`, `Deadline` and `Event`.
`Deadline:` Task to be completed by a deadline.
`Event:` Task to start at a start time and end at an end time.
Adds a new `ToDo` task to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have [NUMBER OF TASKS] tasks in the list sir.
Invalid format. Description cannot be empty for todo sir.
Adds a new `Deadline` task to the task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have [NUMBER OF TASKS] tasks in the list sir.
Adds a new `Event` task to the task list.
**Format**: event [TASK NAME] /from [START TIME in dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm] /to [END TIME in dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm]
Got it. I've added this task:
[E][] [TASK NAME] (from: [DAY, MMM dd, yyyy HH AM/PM] to: [DAY, MMM dd, yyyy HH AM/PM])
Now you have [NUMBER OF TASKS] tasks in the list sir.
Lists all tasks in the task list.
2: [E][] [TASK NAME] (from: [DAY, MMM dd, yyyy HH AM/PM] to: [DAY, MMM dd, yyyy HH AM/PM])
Task list is empty! Please add a task sir.
❗**TASK INDEX must be within the size of the task list**
Nice! I've marked this task as done sir:
❗**TASK INDEX must be within the size of the task list**
Oh NO! I've unmarked this task as undone sir:
Delete a task from the task list.
❗**TASK INDEX must be within the size of the task list**
Noted sir. I've removed this task sir:
Now you have [NUMBER OF TASKS] tasks in the list!
Search for a task from the task list via description
💡**Search will return all tasks which description contains the search keyword**
- find /description homework will return tasks with descriptions "homework", "linear algebra homework", "science homework"
Here are tasks that matched your search sir:
❗**If no matches are found, this will be the error prompt:**
No results found. Please check your keyword is correct sir?
Good bye sir! Have a good day

* @throws IOException if any I/O error occurs.

* The entry point of the Jarvis application.

* @throws IOException if any I/O error occurs.

* User command to execute an action
* Will be inherited by the other commands
public enum CommandType {TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, FIND, EXIT};
* @param commandType The specific type of the command, which is one of the predefined values in the 'CommandType' enum.
* This method should be overridden by subclasses to provide the specific logic for executing each command type.
* @param ui          The 'Ui' object to interact with the user interface.
* @param dataStorage The 'Storage' object to read/write task data from/to storage.
* @param tasks       The 'TaskList' object to manipulate and hold the task data.
* @throws JarvisException If any issue arises during the command execution, it throws a custom exception to be handled at a higher level.
public void executeCommand(Ui ui, Storage dataStorage, TaskList tasks) throws JarvisException {}
* Determines if the command is an exit command.
* @return A boolean value indicating whether the command type is 'EXIT'.

* This method will add a new deadline task to the task list and update the storage.

* @param dataStorage The Storage object, responsible for saving task data to the file.
* @param tasks       The TaskList object, which manages the list of tasks.

* @param dataStorage The Storage object, responsible for updating task data in the file.
* @param tasks       The TaskList object, which manages the list of tasks.
* @throws JarvisException if an invalid task index is provided or other exceptions while deleting a task.
public void executeCommand(Ui ui, Storage dataStorage, TaskList tasks) throws JarvisException {

* @param userInput The input string provided by the user, used to construct a ToDo task.

* Adds a ToDo task to the task list using user input and ensures that the task data is

* add a new task and the 'updateFile' method from 'Storage' to update the storage file.

* @param dataStorage The 'Storage' object to read/write task data from/to storage.

* Handles the creation and status setting of a Todo task.
